p: Recent research has focused on the eCBS as a possible alternative target to treat PTSD [ 27, 28]. Evidence highlighted a reduction of endocannabinoid levels [ 29] and cannabinoid receptor type 1 (CB1) receptors up-regulation in the brain of PTSD patients [ 30]. Thus, the use of components derived from Cannabis sativa as cannabidiol (CBD) and Δ 9-tetrahydrocannabinol (Δ 9-THC) has drawn increasing interest as a possible alternative approach to treat PTSD. To reinforce this assumption several studies support cannabis use as self-medication to cope with PTSD symptoms [ 4, 31].
